South Sudan NGO Forum
Supporting its members to save lives and improve lives

"We provide a platform through which NGOs, the Government of South Sudan, the UN, donors, and other external stakeholders can exchange information, share expertise and establish guidelines for a more networked, efficient and effective use of aid resources in South Sudan through information sharing, networking, representation and communication around safety and wellbeing!"

Join NGO Forum

INTERNSHIP INITIATIVE
A CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE

The NGO Forum internship initiative is three-month long opportunity designed to benefit fresh bachelorâ€™s degree or diploma graduates or graduates with no work experience by placing them within pre-selected NGOs for the above specified period of time so as to gain work experience and improve their resumes and chances of getting employment within the humanitarian and/or development sector.
This opportunity is available to South Sudanese nationals only and is intended to provide an opportunity for individuals to substantively contribute to and learn from the work of the pre-selected NGOs who will be hosting them.

Read More!

RESILIENCE EXCHANGE NETWORK
Providing a platform through which NGOs share knowledge, expertise and learning on resilience programming;

The Resilience Exchange Network was established on 1 February, 2018 following a meeting of interested INGOs to discuss issues around resilience programming, financing, delivery of humanitarian and development assistance to populations in need in South Sudan.

Learn About Resilience Exchange Network

Capacity Assessment Tool
Evaluate Your Organization Capacity Status

The South Sudan NGO Forum is honoured to launch the National NGO Capacity Assessment tool and welcome all National NGO members to participate in the capacity assessment exercise.
"A tool aimed to provide qualitative and quantitative information that will inform the NNGO capacity status debate!"

Visit CAT

3Ws Operational Presence
Data Visualization for International and National NGOs at County Level

State Level Coordination
Enhancing the information sharing system among NNGOs across the states

"The National NGO state coordination initiative aims at enhancing the information sharing system among NNGOs across the states of South Sudan by improving already existing coordination systems or providing support in establishing new mechanisms for information sharing where there is none, this has been done through facilitation of coordination, leadership and communication trainings and setting up processes for follow up support for the state coordination leadership teams"

Read More

How does NGO Forum Work?

Statutes of Operations

Information Sharing

The NGO Forum manages an information network in South Sudan constantly hence communicating information on NGO presence in the country

Read More

External Engagement

The NGO Forum represents the interests of its members in external meetings, work discussions and documents, and act on issues of member interest.

Read More

Policy

The NGO Forum works to support and represent priority interests of the Forum members with authorities, donors, UN agencies and other relevant stakeholders.

Read More

SAFETY & Security

The NGO Forum provides members with accessible and timely security and access- related information, advice, and best practices.

Read More

INGO-NNGO Networking

The NGO Forum is committed to strengthening the networking and partnership between international and national NGOs .
